alert.note: Alert for West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Boise and south central Valley Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Centerville, or near Idaho City, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mores Creek Summit around 500 PM MDT. Lowman and Scott Mountain around 520 PM MDT. Helende Campground around 530 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southwestern Idaho.
